Key Match Events: Argentina scored twice, with Julian Álvarez opening the scoring in the 23rd minute and Lionel Messi doubling their lead in the 51st minute.
Canada had several chances but were unable to convert, with Tani Oluwaseyi coming closest with two point-blank opportunities.
Argentina's goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez used time-wasting tactics late in the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's manager praised the team's resilience and performance in the tournament.
Argentina's victory marked their progression to the final, while Canada's journey ended in the semifinal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a competitive semifinal where Canada held their own against the reigning World Cup champions.
Canada's best chance came via a point-blank shot by Tani Oluwaseyi.
Others: The game was held at Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina.
